context: Can I connect a headset that only has one 3.5mm connection and be able to use both the headset and the mic? There is only one line from the headset.

context: is it hard to hook up
response: Its really easy. Just like any other game sysystem

context: it really has all of the mgs games from mgs1 to mgs4? including snake eater?
response: Every game except Ground Zeroes.

context: Can this be played offline? The person who I am buying this for does NOT have internet. Will he still be able to play the full game?
response: yes I play offline all the time

context: How long is the warranty of product
response: All the instructions and other vital documents that come in the box are all in Japanese, so I couldn't tell you exactly. But the product is indeed used, as the box has been opened prior to shipping, so I'd assume it would be under a year.

context: I have 2 one year ps plus cards..I redeemed 1 back in nov. Anyone know if I can go ahead and redeem the 2nd so I don't forget about it?
response: I have 4 activated right now. Redeem away.

context: what means canadian cover?
response: i mean the picture on the box cover .

context: Does this game allow split screen mode?
response: Sorry, no, for neither single or multiplayer

context: why does it say "Batteries 2 AA batteries required."? never seen a wired mouse that needs batteries, could that be a mistake?
response: I thought mine came with a battery, but it appears to just be a magnet

context: Does it work with Windows 8 and 8.1?
response: yes, i have windows 8 and works perfectly.

context: What is the sexual content in this game?
response: well there nothing sexual about this game they dont do nothing sexual

context: Does it come with a docking station?
response: No. Also no mix amp.

context: How is the mamba's tracking while wired? I don't intend to use the wireless at all. I currently use a 3500 Deathadder
response: The Razer Mamba Tournament Edition is wired, if you just want wired that can be a good option

context: I love Red Alert and Red Alert 2/Yuri's Revenge. Will they run on 8.1? I had problems with the decades edition where they wouldn't open.
response: I tried Yuri's Revenge, and it skips once you get into the game. So sad.

context: Will it work on Windows 7?
response: I am sorry to say that on my windows 7 it failed to load.  I am not very computer savvy so I complained and the company refunded my money.

context: Are the end connectors 2.5 mm or 3.5 mm?  My son's X31 uses 2.5 mm and a white talkback cable.  Newer X31 models appear to be 3.5mm.
response: 2.5 on both ends.

context: How many save files are there? My girlfriend wants to play as well, can it track multiple people?
response: Yes!  It holds up to 3 save files.

context: Does this Buffalo Game controller have R and L buttons?  Pic doesn't show it.
response: Yes it has the L and R bumpers on the top of the controller. I did a video review of this controller that people seem to like, you can watch it here:http://youtu.be/UgiI711zZiw

context: Is this a recharge remote controller or does it use like regular batteries???
response: You recharge it just like the Sony ps3 controller

context: Are these Rock Band 1 or Rock Band 2 drums?  I need Rock Band 2 to attach cymbals to that aren't compatible with Rock Band 1 Drums.
response: The picture I see is an Rock Band 1 and the cymbals will not work. The Rock Band I bought my grandson is a Rock Band drum set 2 and battery operated and the cymbals will work on it for the XBOX 360. Hope that was helpful to you!

context: does it do both chat and game audio on the xbox one when using the adapter
response: Yes but your going to be experiencing issues while trying to adjust BOTH the adaptor volume and the Skull candy volume.

context: I would like to play multiplayer between a DSi with Mario Kart DS and a newer 3DS console.  Do I need to purchase another Mario Kart DS for the 3DS?
response: The game is compatible through Download play on all versions of the DS Console. The 3DS has a DS Download Play (to play DS games trough local W-Fi) and 3DS Download Play (to play 3DS game through local Wi-Fi) so you don't need two copies.

context: What is the size (Length and Width)? I was wondering if It could fit in the pull-out tray of my desk.
response: it is 8.5 inches by 20 inches, it fits on a small keyboard tray, not a lot of room left, but enough to tightly fit a mouse

context: can you change language to english and have everything like us version and can you use your us psn account?
response: I use HK psn account, I think you can choose any psn account. And yes, you can change language. I bought several us version games and they all work well.

context: Can I program the keys to enter passwords?
response: You can set macros, however that's a very unreliable way of doing it since anyone could press the button. The side keys are meant to be used as a number pad or action buttons in video games such as what this mouse is designed for.

context: Does this really work with OSX 10.9.5?  I bought games recently and they wouldn't work on this operating system.  It was a pain to try to get my money
response: It works but I went from PC Hoyle to Mac and do not like it and they have removed a lot of games.

context: is it compatible with the wii
response: I cant imagine that it would be. The graphics are better and the wii u has a better processor.  While you can play your old wii games on the wii u, I don't think it goes in reverse.
